title: The Best Riddles & Brainteasers for Teens & Adults

steps.content: What has lots of eyes but can’t see? [1] X Research source Answer: A potato.
What has hands but can’t clap? Answer: A clock.
What can you catch but not throw? Answer: A cold.
What is cut on a table but is never eaten? Answer: A deck of cards.
What has words but never speaks? Answer: A book.
What is orange and sounds like a parrot? [2] X Research source Answer: A carrot.
What has a bottom at the top? Answer: Your legs.
What kind of vegetable needs a plumber? Answer: A leek.
What is red and smells like blue paint? Answer: Red paint.
Which word starts and finishes with the letter “E” but only has one letter? Answer: Envelope.
What are two things you can never eat for breakfast? [3] X Research source Answer: Lunch and dinner.
What word gets shorter when you add more letters to it? Answer: Short.
What grows when it eats but dies when it drinks? Answer: Fire.
What is something you can easily hold in your right hand but never in your left hand? Answer: Your left elbow.
What has three letters and starts with gas? Answer: A car.
When is a door no longer a door? Answer: When it is ajar.
What is so fragile that speaking its name will break it? Answer: Silence.
What has a tongue but never says a word? Answer: A shoe.
What kind of coat is always wet when you put it on? [4] X Research source Answer: A coat of paint.
What belongs to you, but others use it more than you? Answer: Your name.
What loses its head in the morning but gets it back at night? [5] X Research source Answer: A pillow.
Who makes it has no need of it. Who buys it has no use for it. Who uses it can not see or feel it. What is it? Answer: A coffin.
Tim’s height is six feet. He’s an assistant at a butcher’s shop. He wears size nine shoes. What does he weigh? Answer: Meat.
I can be cracked, made, told, and played. What am I? Answer: A joke.
What is there one of in every corner and two of in every room? [6] X Research source Answer: The letter “O.”
You are my brother, but I am not your brother. Who am I? Answer: Your sister.
You throw away my outside, eat my inside, and throw away the inside. What am I? Answer: Corn on the cob.
What is it that when given one, you’ll have either two or none? Answer: A choice.
There are two fathers and two sons in a car. How many people are in the car? Answer: Three people—a grandfather, a father, and a son.
It’s shorter than the rest, but when you’re satisfied, you bring it up. What is it? Answer: Your thumb.
If you have it, you don’t share it. If you share it, you don’t have it. What is it? Answer: A secret.
What goes up but never comes down? Answer: Your age.
What gets wet while drying? Answer: A towel.
What has to be broken before you can use it? [7] X Research source Answer: An egg.
You’re in a race and pass the person in second place. What place are you in now? Answer: Second place.
What question can you never answer “yes” to? Answer: “Are you asleep yet?”
There’s a one-story house, and everything is yellow. What color are the stairs? Answer: There aren’t any—it’s a one-story house.
I shave every day, but my beard stays the same. What am I? Answer: A barber.
The more of this there is, the less you see. What is it? Answer: Darkness.
I follow you all the time and copy your every move, but you can’t touch me or catch me. What am I? Answer: Your shadow.
What is full of holes but still holds water? Answer: A sponge.
How can you go 10 days without sleep? Answer: You sleep at night.
I’m full of holes but strong as steel. What am I? Answer: A chain.
What has 13 hearts but no lungs or stomach? Answer: A deck of cards.
What tree can you carry in your hand? Answer: Palm tree.
What can go through glass without breaking it? Answer: Light.
What cannot be kept until it is given? Answer: A promise.
What is made of water but dissolves when put in the water? Answer: Ice.
What has a head and a tail but no body? Answer: A coin.
What has branches but no leaves or fruits? [8] X Research source Answer: A bank.
What has four fingers and a thumb but is not living? [9] X Research source Answer: A glove.
What starts with T, ends with T, and has T in it? Answer: A teapot.
What kind of ship has two mates but no captain? Answer: A relationship.
What is the longest word in the dictionary? Answer: Smiles because there’s a mile between each “s.”
What is at the end of a rainbow? Answer: A “W.”
They come out at night without being called and are lost in the day without being stolen. What are they? Answer: Stars.
What is always in front of you but can’t be seen? Answer: The future.
I cannot talk but always reply when spoken to. What am I? Answer: An echo.
What can be touched but can’t be seen? Answer: Someone’s heart.
What goes through cities and fields but never moves? Answer: A road.
